Detailed Description

Functions for accessing memory and CSRs on Octeon when we are compiling natively.

Revision
38306

Define Documentation

#define CVMX_BUILD_READ64 ( TYPE,
LT   ) 
Value:
static inline TYPE##_t cvmx_read64_##TYPE(uint64_t addr)                \
{                                                                       \
    return *CASTPTR(volatile TYPE##_t, addr);                           \
}
#define CVMX_BUILD_WRITE64 ( TYPE,
ST   ) 
Value:
static inline void cvmx_write64_##TYPE(uint64_t addr, TYPE##_t val)     \
{                                                                       \
    *CASTPTR(volatile TYPE##_t, addr) = val;                            \
}
#define CVMX_DEFAULT_ROOT_NODE   0

Function Documentation

static void* __cvmx_phys_to_ptr_internal__ ( uint64_t  physical_address  )  [inline, static]

Convert a hardware physical address (uint64_t) into a memory pointer (void *).

Parameters:
physical_address Hardware physical address to memory
Returns:
Pointer to memory

NOTE: Internal use only

static uint64_t __cvmx_ptr_to_phys2_internal__ ( void *  ptr  )  [inline, static]

Convert a memory pointer (void*) into a hardware compatable memory address (uint64_t).

Octeon hardware widgets don't understand logical addresses.

Parameters:
ptr C style memory pointer
Returns:
Hardware physical address

NOTE: This function should return the correct value in all cases. NOTE: Internal use only

static uint64_t __cvmx_ptr_to_phys_internal__ ( void *  ptr  )  [inline, static]

Convert a memory pointer (void*) into a hardware compatable memory address (uint64_t).

Octeon hardware widgets don't understand logical addresses.

Parameters:
ptr C style memory pointer
Returns:
Hardware physical address

NOTE: In simple executive this function will not return correct data in many cases and should only be used for memory allocated using cvmx_bootmem_alloc. Using this function on global variables or on memory allocated from the stack will return incorrect addresses.

NOTE: Internal use only

static uint64_t cvmx_get_cycle ( void   )  [inline, static]
Deprecated:
Provide current cycle counter as a return value. Deprecated, use cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) to get cycle counter.
Returns:
current cycle counter
static uint64_t cvmx_get_cycle_global ( void   )  [inline, static]
Deprecated:
Reads a chip global cycle counter. This counts SCLK cycles since chip reset. The counter is 64 bit. This function is deprecated as the rate of the global cycle counter is different between Octeon+ and Octeon2, use cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_SCLK) instead. For Octeon2, the clock rate of SCLK may be differnet than the core clock.
Returns:
Global chip cycle count since chip reset.
static unsigned int cvmx_get_local_core_num ( void   )  [inline, static]

Returns:
core number on local node

Number of the node on which the program is currently running.

current node number

static uint32_t cvmx_pop ( uint32_t  val  )  [inline, static]

Returns the number of bits set in the provided value.

Simple wrapper for POP instruction.

Parameters:
val 32 bit value to count set bits in
Returns:
Number of bits set
static uint64_t cvmx_ptr_to_phys ( void *  ptr  )  [inline, static]

Convert a memory pointer (void*) into a hardware compatable memory address (uint64_t).

Octeon hardware widgets don't understand logical addresses.

Parameters:
ptr C style memory pointer
Returns:
Hardware physical address

NOTE: For simple executive applications this should only be used for pointers allocated using cvmx_bootmem_alloc. Using this on pointers to global variables or memory allocated on the stack may return incorrect values. This function is much faster than cvmx_ptr_to_phys2() due to this assumption.

static uint64_t cvmx_ptr_to_phys2 ( void *  ptr  )  [inline, static]

Convert a memory pointer (void *) into a hardware compatible memory address (uint64_t).

Octeon hardware widgets don't understand logical addresses.

Parameters:
ptr C style memory pointer
Returns:
Hardware physical address

NOTE: This function should return the correct value in all cases.

) [inline, static]

) [inline, static]

Returns:
value of CSR address

NOTE: If the NODE is already encoded in csr_addr then the node in the address will be overwritten with the node parameter.
